items.title: Add ability to change font-family for SVG output
items.body:
Currently, blockdiag always use 'sans-serif'. This cause problems with applications that use blockdiag as SVG generator like 'asciidoctor'. See https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-pdf/issues/777

----------------------------------------
- Bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag/issue/82
- Originally reported by: [nbkolchin](https://bitbucket.org/nbkolchin)
- Originally created at: 2017-03-20T02:07:00.468

- Originally reported by: Petri Savolainen
- Originally created at: 2015-05-12T09:01:46.958

items.title: AttributeError: close
items.body:
Hi,

I have following code:


```
#!python

nwdiag {
  a [shape = "cisco.router"];
  b [shape = "cisco.router_firewall"];
  c [shape = "cisco.pc"];
  a -- b -- c;
}

```

If i run:

```
# nwdiag --debug -T PNG -o neu.png neu
```

... i get:

```
File "/home/victor/work/blog/pelican/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/blockdiag/drawer.py", line 88, in draw
    self._draw_background()
  File "/home/victor/work/blog/pelican/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nwdiag/drawer.py", line 40, in _draw_background
    super(DiagramDraw, self)._draw_background()
  File "/home/victor/work/blog/pelican/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/blockdiag/drawer.py", line 114, in _draw_background
    shape = r(node, self.metrics)
  File "/home/victor/work/blog/pelican/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/blockdiagcontrib/cisco.py", line 38, in __init__
    size = images.get_image_size(image_path)
  File "/home/victor/work/blog/pelican/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/blockdiag/utils/images.py", line 52, in get_image_size
    f.close()
  File "/home/victor/work/blog/pelican/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 537, in __getattr__
    raise AttributeError(name)
AttributeError: close
```

The main problem seems to be in `blockdiag/utils/images.py' in the `get_image_size` function:

```
def get_image_size(filename):
    image = None
    try:
        image = open(filename)
        return image.size
    finally:
        if image:
            image.close()
```

When you **open** the file an Image object is returned, since `open` is defined as a function in the same file. The image object however contains no method `close`. I guess you wanted to use python's internal `open` function. I don't know what might solve the problem:

* Rename your function `open` to something else
* Remove the `finally` block

Thx in advance.

Cheers,

Peter

items.title: Problems with stdin input ( blockdiag -o x.png - ) and python 3.x
items.body:
hg summary:

```
#!

aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ hg summary
parent: 1540:c7b0971ca21a tip
 Added tag 1.4.3 for changeset b7481dd07fe9
branch: default
commit: 1 unknown (clean)
update: (current)

```

On 2.7:

```
#!

aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ python2.7 setup.py -q install --user
warning: no previously-included files found matching '.drone.io.sh'
warning: no previously-included files found matching 'examples/update.sh'
zip_safe flag not set; analyzing archive contents...
blockdiag.tests.test_pep8: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.utils: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.test_utils_fontmap: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.test_generate_diagram: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.rst.test_base_directives: module references __file__
aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ blockdiag --version
blockdiag 1.4.3
aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ cat examples/screen.diag | blockdiag -o screen-1.4.3-2.7.png -

```

On 3.3:
```
#!

aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ python3.3 setup.py -q install --user
warning: no previously-included files found matching '.drone.io.sh'
warning: no previously-included files found matching 'examples/update.sh'
zip_safe flag not set; analyzing archive contents...
blockdiag.tests.rst.__pycache__.test_base_directives.cpython-33: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.__pycache__.test_generate_diagram.cpython-33: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.__pycache__.utils.cpython-33: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.__pycache__.test_utils_fontmap.cpython-33: module references __file__
blockdiag.tests.__pycache__.test_pep8.cpython-33: module references __file__
aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ blockdiag --version
blockdiag 1.4.3
aucampia@host:~/projects/bitbucket.org/blockdiag/blockdiag
$ cat examples/screen.diag | blockdiag -o screen-1.4.3-2.7.png -
ERROR: can't concat bytes to str

```

This problem is related with changes in IO in python 3.x - stdin is already a decoded stream.

I will submit a merge request shortly that fixes this so it works on 2.7 and 3.3 (and hopefully other 2.x and 3.x versions also).

items.title: blockdiag.imagedraw.png.ImageDrawExBase: Cannot use image attribute together with image() method
items.body:
The class above has an `image` attribute and an `image()` method. The later defined one overrides the earlier one in the classes dict. Therefore, attributes must have a different name compared to methods. You need to rename one of the two, for example rename `image` attribute to `image_` (and hunt for all the used places outside the class).

In addition, the image() method has another problem. It uses an unknown variable name in its exception handling (OOPS, handled exception leads to another unintended exception):

    #!python
    ...
    def image(self):
        ...
        msg = "WARNING: Could not retrieve: %s\n" % filename
        # SHOULD-BE: filename parameter is undefined.
        msg = "WARNING: Could not retrieve: %s\n" % url

Note that I stumbled over the same problem in other files, too. You should basically check for the filename pattern above or use the background hint from below to detect all places.

**BACKGROUND:**
After providing seqdiag issue #12, I applied `pychecker` and `pylint` to `blockdiag`. This was one of the issues.

items.body:

items.title: Import PIL components from the ``PIL`` namespace  instead of the global namespace
items.body:
Currently the blockdiag code imports the PIL components directly from the global namespace which normally works because PIL mangles the modules there. 

However, this mangling may not always work (e.g. when using zc.buildout  to setup an environment) which results in import errors. Importing the PIL components explicitly from the PIL namespace allows the imports to work regardless of the mangling.

The attached patch fixes the issue.

----------------------------------------

items.title: 文字化け：WindowsでのPILのFontの取り扱いによる文字化け
items.body:
http://d.hatena.ne.jp/tanakahisateru/20081008/1223450159

"PIL(Python Image Libraly)で日本語フォント使おうとすると、ラスタライズ結果がぐちゃぐちゃになることがある。これはハマった。

つぶれる条件はどうやら、ビットマップを持つフォントのビットマップが適用される場合のようだ。ビットマップが適用されないぐらい十分大きいサイズで描いて、それを目的のサイズに縮小して問題を回避。アンチエイリアスされた文字を得るのが目的ならこれでOK。"

scaleを3倍に設定すれば化けずに描画されることを確認しました。ひどいパッチを添付します。
